item.title: Trump Officials Announce More Than $11 Billion in Arms Sales for Taiwan
item.description: The move may reassure China hawks who are uncertain about the president’s commitment to the self-governing democracy.
item.dc:creator: Michael Crowley
item.media:description: The arms package would include more than $4 billion each for high mobility artillery rocket systems, known as HIMARS.

item.title: 6 Takeaways From Trump’s Address to the Nation
item.description: President Trump disparaged Democrats and insisted the economy is booming despite concerns about the cost of living.
item.dc:creator: David E. Sanger
item.media:description: President Trump in an address from the White House on Wednesday argued that U.S. economy under his leadership is in better shape than many voters think.

item.title: U.S. Military Announces 4 Killed in 26th Boat Strike
item.description: The attack on Wednesday brings the total number killed to at least 99 since the Trump administration began bombing boats suspected of ferrying drugs in the Caribbean Sea and the Pacific Ocean.
item.dc:creator: Adam Sella
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
US Strikes on Alleged Drug Traffickers (2025- )
item.media:description: U.S. attacks on boats off South America have drawn the ire of legal experts and many members of Congress, who contend that the strikes amount to extrajudicial killings and, potentially, war crimes.

item.title: Fact-Checking Trump’s Prime-Time Address on the Economy
item.description: The president cited misleading statistics to insist, wrongly, that prices were coming down.
item.dc:creator: Linda Qiu
item.category: White House Council of Economic Advisers
item.media:description: President Trump used a prime-time address to praise what he cast as the economic gains under his administration.

item.title: Australia to Crack Down on Hate Speech After Bondi Attack
item.description: New legislation will be drafted to target those who promote violence and to increase penalties for hate speech, the prime minister said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Yan Zhuang
item.media:credit: Matthew Abbott for The New York Times
item.media:description: New South Wales police officers escorting the hearse carrying Rabbi Eli Schlanger after his funeral in Sydney, Australia, on Wednesday.

item.title: Full Transcript of President Trump’s Speech on the Economy
item.description: The president sharply attacked his predecessor while insisting that his own record contained nothing but victories.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times
item.media:description: “Over the past 11 months, we have brought more positive change to Washington than any administration in American history,” President Trump said in his address to the nation on Wednesday night from the Diplomatic Reception Room of the White House.

item.title: In Combative Speech, Trump Tries to Deflect Blame for Economic Concerns
item.description: Mixing misleading claims with repeated attacks, President Trump promised relief for Americans but said he needed time to deliver it.
item.dc:creator: Luke Broadwater

item.title: Investigators look at a Santa Monica hotel as they trace Nick Reiner’s movements.
item.dc:creator: Orlando Mayorquín, Matt Stevens and Shawn Hubler
item.media:description: The Pierside Santa Monica hotel on Tuesday.

item.title: Shock and Sadness Hang Over the Reiners’ Neighborhood
item.description: Neighbors said a pall had fallen over the wealthy Los Angeles area where Rob Reiner and his wife, Michele, were found stabbed to death.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Parsons
item.media:description: Holiday decorations and no trespassing signs on a gate outside the Reiners’ home on Tuesday.

item.title: U.S. Government Admits Liability in Deadly D.C.-Area Air Collision
item.description: A federal court filing says the Army crew piloting a Black Hawk helicopter could have avoided the nighttime accident in January if it had been able to see and avoid a commercial jet.
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron and Kate Kelly
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:credit: Al Drago for The New York Times
item.media:description: A crane lifting a piece of the wreckage of an American Airlines jet from the Potomac River in February.

item.title: Trump Pressed Georgia Speaker to Overturn State’s Election Vote in 2020 Call
item.description: During much of the 12.5-minute call, President Trump reiterated his claims that he had won Georgia, a state he lost by more than 11,000 votes that year.
item.dc:creator: Richard Fausset and Danny Hakim
item.category: Georgia Criminal Case Against Trump (2020 Election)
item.media:credit: Audra Melton for The New York Times
item.media:description: David Ralston, the former Georgia House speaker, in 2018.

item.title: For Hegseth, There Is One Boat Strike He Doesn’t Want the Public to See
item.description: The Pentagon has released plenty of video clips that show American missiles blowing boats suspected of carrying drugs out of the water. But the “double tap” strike on Sept. 2 is being kept under wraps.
item.dc:creator: David E. Sanger
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
item.media:description: Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth briefed senators on Tuesday.

item.title: Trump Unveils Presidential ‘Walk of Fame’ With Jabs at Biden and Obama
item.description: The White House unveiled plaques near the Oval Office that describe U.S. presidents with varying levels of accuracy, depending on President Trump’s opinion of them.
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron
item.media:description: The presidential walk of fame, the latest addition to the White House, seen at the White House on Wednesday.

item.title: Trump’s handling of the economy has dragged down his approval rating.
item.dc:creator: Ruth Igielnik and Tyler Pager

item.title: Trump’s National Address: What Time and What to Expect
item.description: President Trump will address the nation on Wednesday night at 9 p.m. Eastern time. The New York Times will provide live coverage and analysis.
item.dc:creator: Erica L. Green, Tony Romm, David E. Sanger and Luke Broadwater

item.title: Senate Passes Air Safety Measure, Reversing Provision in Defense Bill
item.description: The legislation restores restrictions on military aircraft flying near busy airports, implemented after a fatal collision near D.C. in January, that had been removed in the defense bill.
item.dc:creator: Karoun Demirjian
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation
item.media:credit: Andrew Leyden for The New York Times
item.media:description: After the Jan. 29 midair collision between a commercial jet and an Army helicopter near Ronald Reagan National Airport outside Washington, the federal government tightened restrictions on when military aircraft could fly without enhanced tracking technology.

item.title: ICE Must Allow Lawmakers to Inspect Detention Centers, Judge Rules
item.description: Judge Jia M. Cobb wrote that two policies announced in June appeared to unlawfully bar members of Congress from making unannounced visits at immigration detention facilities.
item.dc:creator: Zach Montague and Michael Gold
item.media:credit: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times
item.media:description: Federal agents outside Delaney Hall Detention Facility in Newark in June. Immigration and Customs Enforcement has curbed access to its detention centers and required seven days’ notice for lawmakers seeking entry.

item.title: Search for Suspect in Brown University Shooting Stretches to 4th Day
item.description: Officials said that they were working with physical evidence, including DNA, and that they were seeking a second man who appeared to have crossed paths with the possible suspect.
item.dc:creator: Jacey Fortin and Chelsia Rose Marcius
item.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times
item.media:description: A memorial on the Brown University campus in Providence, R.I., on Wednesday.

item.title: House Passes Bill to Ban Gender Transition Treatments for Minors
item.description: The measure had little chance of consideration in the Senate, where it would need bipartisan support to move, but it reflected the priorities of the Republican majority.
item.dc:creator: Annie Karni and Aishvarya Kavi
item.media:description: Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene, Republican of Georgia, sponsored the legislation criminalizing gender affirming care.

item.title: Bodies of Rob and Michele Reiner Were Found in Master Bedroom, Police Say
item.description: After finding the slain couple, investigators focused on their younger son, Nick, as a suspect. He was formally charged with murder on Tuesday and appeared in court on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Shawn Hubler
item.media:description: The Reiner home in the Brentwood section of Los Angeles on Tuesday.

item.title: HHS Cancels Grants to Group That Criticized RFK Jr.’s Vaccine Policies
item.description: The American Academy of Pediatrics had called the department’s policies “irresponsible and purposefully misleading” and joined a lawsuit against its vaccine policy.
item.dc:creator: Minho Kim
item.media:credit: Michael A. McCoy for The New York Times
item.media:description: The United States Department of Health and Human Services headquarters in October.

item.title: Defense Dept. Opens Formal Inquiry Into Senator Mark Kelly
item.description: The Pentagon said it was initiating a “command investigation” into the senator, another extraordinary step as the Trump administration seeks retribution against the president’s perceived foes.
item.dc:creator: John Ismay
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
item.media:description: Senator Mark Kelly, Democrat of Arizona, retired from the service in 2011 after 24 years of service as a naval aviator and astronaut before running for office. He is being investigated over his participation in a video urging service members to refuse illegal orders.

item.title: House Rejects Measure to Bar Strikes Inside Venezuela
item.description: The Democratic measure was defeated mostly along party lines, along with another resolution that would have halted the military’s escalating campaign of boat attacks.
item.dc:creator: Robert Jimison
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
US Strikes on Alleged Drug Traffickers (2025- )
item.media:description: U.S. military aircraft in Ceiba, Puerto Rico, on Tuesday. For months, the U.S. military has been building up a large naval force there as President Trump continues to threaten to attack Venezuela.

item.title: Trump Finds That Retribution Isn’t Always So Easy
item.description: In some ways, Trump’s broader flexing of power has achieved what he set out to do. But his attempts to push prosecutions of rivals have been far less successful.
item.dc:creator: Michael S. Schmidt and Jonah E. Bromwich
item.media:credit: Allison Robbert for The New York Times
item.media:description: Letitia James, the New York attorney general.

item.title: Dan Bongino to Step Down as FBI Deputy Director
item.description: The departure of Mr. Bongino had seemed inevitable since August, when the White House hired Missouri’s attorney general, Andrew Bailey, to share his job as deputy director.
item.dc:creator: Glenn Thrush, Maggie Haberman and Adam Goldman
item.media:description: Dan Bongino, the F.B.I. deputy director, at the Capitol last month.

item.title: Jack Smith Defends Trump Prosecutions in House Deposition
item.description: Even adversaries of Jack Smith, the former special counsel, conceded that his tight-lipped, painstaking approach made tripping him up particularly difficult.
item.dc:creator: Glenn Thrush and Alan Feuer
item.category: Federal Criminal Case Against Trump (Documents Case)
item.media:credit: Anna Rose Layden for The New York Times
item.media:description: Jack Smith, the former special counsel, during a break in a closed-door deposition with the House Judiciary Committee.

item.title: Woman in ‘Slender Man’ Stabbing Won’t Contest Effort to Revoke Her Release
item.description: Morgan Geyser, who was convicted after she stabbed a friend in 2014 to please a fictional character, was arrested last month after she cut off a monitoring bracelet and fled from a group home.
item.dc:creator: Aimee Ortiz
item.media:description: Morgan Geyser in court in Waukesha, Wis., in 2025. In November, she fled a group home facility where she had been placed and was taken into custody again.

item.title: Trump Administration Aims to Strip More Foreign-Born Americans of Citizenship
item.description: An official with U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services said it would prioritize “those who’ve unlawfully obtained U.S. citizenship.”
item.dc:creator: Hamed Aleaziz
item.media:credit: Tony Luong for The New York Times
item.media:description: A naturalization ceremony in Boston in August. The Trump administration has been closing loopholes in the immigration system and throwing up roadblocks for people seeking to enter and stay in the country.

item.title: Fani Willis Calls Trump and Allies ‘Criminals’ in Hearing Before Georgia Senate Committee
item.description: The district attorney in Atlanta addressed a Republican-led committee created to investigate her conduct during her prosecution of President Trump last year.
item.dc:creator: Richard Fausset and Danny Hakim
item.category: Georgia Criminal Case Against Trump (2020 Election)
item.media:description: District Attorney Fani T. Willis assailed Republican adversaries and stumped for political allies at the hearing on Wednesday.

item.title: Video Footage Shows Nick Reiner Enter Store an Hour Before His Arrest
item.description: Mr. Reiner was filmed entering a gas station’s store in South Los Angeles to buy a sports drink roughly an hour before he was arrested by the police across the street.
item.dc:creator: Orlando Mayorquín

item.title: Nearly $900 Million Flowed in Secret to Help Harris and Trump in 2024
item.description: The main dark-money group backing Kamala Harris and Joe Biden raised a staggering $613 million last year, while its pro-Trump counterpart brought in $275 million, new filings show.
item.dc:creator: Theodore Schleifer and Ashley Cai
item.media:description: Both Donald J. Trump and Kamala Harris benefited heavily from so-called dark money in 2024, but Democrats leaned more on the practice of funneling money through nonprofit groups that do not have to disclose their donors.

item.title: Top Republican Examining Boat Strike ‘Satisfied’ With Military Mission
item.description: After viewing video of a follow-up strike, Republicans largely had confidence in the Pentagon’s legal rationale while Democrats questioned its legality.
item.dc:creator: Robert Jimison
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:description: Representative Mike Rogers, Republican of Alabama, during a hearing on Capitol Hill in July. He leads the House Armed Services Committee, which oversees the military.

item.title: Venezuelan Navy Escorts Vessels in Defiance of Trump’s Blockade Threat
item.description: Pentagon officials, surprised by President Trump’s orders, scrambled to work out a plan to halt sanctioned tankers as Nicolás Maduro, Venezuela’s leader, vowed resistance.
item.dc:creator: Edward Wong, Anatoly Kurmanaev and Eric Schmitt
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:credit: Adriana Loureiro Fernandez for The New York Times
item.media:description: An oil tanker anchored near the Cardón Refinery in Punto Fijo, Venezuela, in 2021.

item.title: ‘Here We Go Again’: In Melania Trump’s Movie, This Time She Knows What She’s Doing
item.description: The first lady is behind a movie that she has said will give a better idea of what it was like for her to move into the White House for a second time.
item.dc:creator: Katie Rogers
item.media:description: Melania Trump is portrayed as in control and assertive in the trailer for her new movie, “Melania.”

item.title: The prosecutors assigned to the Reiners’ killing are familiar with high-profile cases.
item.description: The lawyers, Habib Balian and Jonathan Chung, have managed complex homicide cases that attracted heavy attention from the media.
item.dc:creator: Soumya Karlamangla
item.media:credit: Pool photo by Jae C. Hong
item.media:description: Habib Balian, an assistant head deputy district attorney for Los Angeles County, standing in front of the judge before Nick Reiner appeared in Los Angeles Superior Court on Wednesday.

item.title: Jake and Romy Reiner Release Family Statement After Parents’ Murder
item.description: The daughter and a son of Rob and Michele Singer Reiner spoke publicly for the first time since their parents were found dead on Sunday and their brother was arrested. They asked for respect and privacy.
item.dc:creator: Matt Stevens
item.media:description: Members of the Reiner family in September. Romy Reiner, third from left, and Jake Reiner, right, spoke out on Wednesday after their parents’ murder.

item.title: Reiner’s Son Appears, Briefly, Before a Judge
item.description: Nick Reiner, facing murder charges in the deaths of his parents, Rob and Michele Reiner, appeared at an arraignment that lasted just minutes before it was rescheduled for January. He has not entered a plea.
item.dc:creator: Tim Arango
item.media:description: Alan Jackson, Nick Reiner’s lawyer, speaking to the media outside Los Angeles Superior Court on Wednesday. He asked the public not to “rush to judgment.”

item.title: Ex-Harvard Medical Morgue Manager Who Sold Body Parts Gets 8-Year Sentence
item.description: Cedric Lodge, and his wife, Denise Lodge, stole and sold donated human remains intended for medical research and teaching, prosecutors said.
item.dc:creator: Amanda Holpuch
item.media:credit: Sophie Park for The New York Times
item.media:description: The investigation into the sale of stolen human remains led to indictments for seven people, in addition to Cedric and Denise Lodge.

item.title: ICE Arrests Disrupt Schools, Prompting Fear Among Families
item.description: President Trump’s immigration crackdown has at times resulted in arrests near schools, setting off concerns among parents, educators and students.
item.dc:creator: Madeleine Ngo
item.media:description: Parents say they have grown concerned about taking their children to school, worried that they could be detained or that their children could witness violent arrests.

item.title: Tankers Under Sanction Are Only a Subset of Fleet Moving Venezuelan Oil
item.description: The scope of President Trump’s blockade against ships carrying oil from Venezuela was not clear on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca F. Elliott
item.media:credit: Adriana Loureiro Fernandez for The New York Times
item.media:description: An oil tanker docked at Cardón Refinery in Venezuela, in 2021. More than 400 tankers have moved Venezuelan oil or related products since 2019, and these vessels are part of a bigger fleet of ships that trade oil illicitly.

item.title: Senate Passes Defense Policy Bill, Clearing It for Trump
item.description: The legislation authorizes $900 billion for the Pentagon, provides a pay raise for troops, and has some measures to reassert congressional oversight.
item.dc:creator: Megan Mineiro
item.category: US Strikes on Alleged Drug Traffickers (2025- )
item.media:description: Army troops participating in a parade in Washington in June. The bill includes a pay raise of 3.8 percent for military personnel.

item.title: Appeals Court Allows National Guard to Remain in D.C., for Now
item.description: A three-judge panel voted unanimously to allow troops to stay in the capital for the duration of the appeal, citing the city’s unique legal status.
item.dc:creator: Zach Montague
item.category: US Federal Takeover of Metropolitan Police Dept (DC)
United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:description: National Guard troops in Washington in August. A lower court judge had ordered that the troops be removed from the city, but the appeals court previously stayed the ruling while it considered the matter.

item.title: Republicans Clinch Democrats’ Bid to Force Vote on ACA Subsidies
item.description: After the speaker denied them a vote on extending the subsidies, four Republicans from competitive districts joined Democrats’ bid to go around G.O.P. leaders and force action.
item.dc:creator: Michael Gold
item.category: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
item.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times

item.title: Here’s the latest.
item.dc:creator: Tim Arango, Shawn Hubler, Orlando Mayorquín and Jill Cowan

item.title: Billy Crystal, Meg Ryan and Others Remember Rob Reiner as a ‘Master Story Teller’
item.description: A group of prominent figures issued a statement memorializing Mr. Reiner and his wife, Michele Singer Reiner. “We were their friends, and we will miss them forever.”
item.dc:creator: Ali Watkins
item.media:description: Rob Reiner, left, with Billy Crystal and Meg Ryan during an anniversary screening of “When Harry Met Sally” in 2019.
